chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Antonio Jahvari Shannon

records.addlTxt: Calendar call on January 5, 2023 at 08:30 am.

1:13 PM Defendant Antonio Jahvari Shannon appeared by phone.  Attorney Walter H Isaacson appeared by video for Antonio Jahvari Shannon.  Prosecuting attorney Margaret Nan Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived. Defendant pleads not guilty. Matter to be set. Victim addresses court.

1:29 PM  Defendant Antonio Jahvari Shannon appeared by phone.  Attorney Walter H Isaacson in court for Antonio Jahvari Shannon.  Prosecuting attorney Kyle Edward Johnson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Victim present in person.  Copy of complaint to attorney.  Reading waived.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information.
Arraignment scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
A victim in this matter has requested to be notified and present at  all proceedings as well as be present at the sentencing hearing
Adjourned initial appearance on August 31, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Justice Point: Rock County Pretrial Risk Report
No driving without a valid drivers license and insurance. No contact directly or indirectly with victims AEC, VJH, ALS, or SLS, his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere.

3:03 PM Prosecuting attorney Mary Bricco appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Antonio Jahvari Shannon appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Refugio Cuco Longoria appeared by video for Antonio Jahvari Shannon. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Signature bond set of $2000 with conditions. No driving without a valid drivers license and insurance. No contact directly or indirectly with victims AEC, VJH, ALS, or SLS, his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
